review: I've been here fella few times in the past..... but last month was my 1st time in at least a few years. I happened to meet a friend to grab a drink and appetizer  I got carded getting into the bar. Lol. Guess I'll take it as a compliment since I'm wayyyy over the age I like the set up of the bar area. We were tended to right away- the bartender was nice  I don't expect top notch stuff here. It's American bar food that has way too sodium and calories. I like that the menu tells you the calories to help you keep you in check that you are about to each 500-1500 calories lol We shared bones less wings and spinach dip- which were ok/decent. Nothing to sing about  Evidently it was " karaoke night" ---it was a weekday night and not many people there and NOONE was doing karaoke.... the music was WAY too loud that I couldn't even have a conversation with my friend which was the main reason we had come. Once the DJ started playing music - I just could take it. It was that loud!  Would I come back? Maybe ... but hells no to karaoke night for sure lol

Well, it's a chain restaurant. Which in itself isn't a bad thing, but unfortunately there not too much here that wows me.  I was a bit disappointed that despite the fact that the menu specifically instructs you to ask about their local craft beer selection, the bartender seemed to have no clue what craft beer was, and they certainly did not have any available.  In terms of food, everything on the menu is about $2 more than it should be for this type of restaurant. I'm not sure if the inflated prices are just because of the area or if Fridays charges them in all their renovated restaurants. I got the shrimp tacos which were in special, but was severely disappointed. Three mini shrimp on each of the two tacos with lettuce and tomato. I would not order again.

So we came here on a Tuesday night to have girl talk and I have to say -I thought the atmosphere was fine. I didn't know that they had karaoke on Tuesday evening but the music was still enjoyable. Although it was hardly anyone there, we got serviced pretty quickly within a reasonable amount of time.  I ordered the Electric Lemonade which was EXTREMELY watered down and my friend had water. However, I couldn't really complain because it was happy hour and I was not expecting to get seriously drunk off of a happy hour drink. I also had the Spinach & Artichoke dip which was AMAZING and the Mozzarella sticks which were pretty good.  The only other quarrel I had other than the watered down drink (coolade lol) was the music seemed extremely loud! So loud that we pretty much had to yell to even talk to each other. However, they were playing great songs-enough to make you want to dance. So overall it wasn't bad and I will still come back for a bite to eat and/or good music!

Ran out of clean silverware after we ate our entrees. In a restaurant only 1/4 full. Dessert was eaten with plastic spoons. I've travelled extensively and have yet to encounter this situation in even the poorest countries. Bathrooms were frightening, both women's and men's. Out of 4 stalls, 3 were unflushed and the 4th had t.p. hanging off the seat into the bowl. There was a dried brown substance above the door handle. Sinks were sopping wet with paper towels overflowing the bin. I realize these are the disgusting habits of customers, but aren't staff supposed to check/clean the bathrooms every so often?  Service was slower than a snail: It took 5 minutes to be seated as the hostess couldn't be found. And later, when she could be found, appeared to be chatting up a guy at the front (who, despite sitting on a stool behind the podium next to the hostess, didn't appear to be staff...)  Similarly we lost our waitress after our entrees were served. After clicking the "call server" button on the tabletop tablet and waiting for 15 minutes, we finally got up and walked to the hostess stand to ask for assistance in finding our server. The hostess said she'd find our server but continued to sit there entertaining her friend. Perhaps she used ESP? The food was good, but that's not surprising considering it's shipped pre-cooked to each location and then simply warmed up. And the server was sweet - when she was around. It's not her fault they didn't have clean silverware.      I'm very surprised corporate office allows this to happen. Every other Fridays' I've been to has been above average in service and cleanliness. I'd pick another restaurant if I were you. We will next time for sure.

Wholly God I wish I read this before coming.  Horrible staff I got 1 soda and never again.  I saw my waitress only when my initial order was rudely taken and the place was EMPTY at 1pm!  Wow it was bad!  Poor service, unfriendly and inattentive being I was literally 1 of 3 customers.

This place is terrible never had such a bad service no wonder they only have one star im pretty sure if there was a zero star that is what they would have... never again we got our dessert and not one of our dirty dishes were picked up they just put it on top like wtf kind of service is this on too of everything our table was not check not even one time

The only thing good we had was the sampler that included Jack Daniels chicken and ribs. My French onion soup was horrible loaded with cheese and bread. My boyfriend got the bacon cheeseburger and he couldn't eat it as it was soaked in layers of cheese

This Fridays is very hit or miss. I've come in here and had horrible service but have also had phenomenal service. This specific visit was very decent; our waitress was very friendly and nice but slightly absent. The food itself was pretty decent as well, not great but not horrible either. All in all, it's about what you should be expecting from a Fridays; decent service and decent food.

Horrible service. I've been to this location about 4 times and finally learned my lesson. We were seated, and took about 10 mins to have our drink and food order taken. I ordered a Blue Moon and my gf got a cocktail. Ten mins later, waitress comes with the cocktail, no beer. Apparently there was no Blue Moon left. Okay, got a Stella.  We had ordered appetizers...our main dishes came out before the app. What a joke. Do yourselves a favor, do not go here unless they change management. I used the restroom, and 4 of the wait staff were just hanging out and looking at their phones. Oh yeah, the bathroom was disgusting.

This place is huge with multiple dinning areas and a full service bar. I counted 12 television screens showing sports games, the news and even BET.  The bartender was okay and not so friendly - it must be the end of the shift (9:40pm). But he does seem to muster up some enthusiasm to tend to me and my lady. The specialty cocktail I ordered was (is) pretty good; I went with the Ultimate Mojito and my lady got the Not You Father's Root Beer -- both really tasty. The food was ok and tasted all the same in the Appetizer Sampler - but darn I love that Jack Daniel Sauce...mmmm!
Shocked at the low ratings. Our waitress was on point despite the wait for the food. Waters refilled,  any more apps? Very attentive, and the food was on point.. that always helps! Thank you!

This is the worst TGIF I have ever been to in my life and I will never return! I don't know where to begin.  We went here for my son birthday and it was a complete disaster!  Took forever for us to order and get our food and the place wasn't crowded.  Some of the plates look like the food was thrown on it.  Food was over cooked.  One dinner was cold and the another was wrong.  I had to ask twice for a child's food to come because they served her a rare hamburger instead of well done.  The waitress didn't bring the food until after everyone was done eating.  We asked them to sing happy birthday and the waitress came out with ice cream and no one sang so we did it.  Waited 45 mins for the checks which were wrong.  Asked for a manger and was told he was helping cook so he couldn't come.  It took several attempts to get our checks.  When the waitress finally made an appearance I told her our complaints and she slammed the check down and told us she is doing the best she can and she don't know what to tell us and then she ran off crying.  It was at that point the "manager" finally made an appearance.  He had so many excuses and was so unprofessional I don't know how he became a manager.  He actually defended the reason for the trouble and expected us to ok with.  Then walked away with a sarcastic "happy holidays".  We were a table of ten and a group of very heavy tippers.  Needless to say no tip was left.  This place is horrible!  This is just a small portion of the many many issues we encountered.   My suggestion is to stay away and go somewhere else.
It was quite obvious our waiter had a long day here, however as a customer don't take that out on me with a semi rude attitude.

Although I went with my colleagues; a group of about 30, the service was not very prompt. They managed to give my food to the wrong person, you would think that with such a big group they would adjust and have proper waiters. I was truly disappointed.

I concur with most reviews.... this place is a dump.  Slow service, zero QC (cold fries hot burger, au jus was missing and once requested we were given a bowl of French onion soup) what a joke.  This will be the last time I go to Fridays.

Most ghetto Fridays ever, it smelled like weed at the front door. Called in an order 30 mins ahead, when I went to pick up my order the hostess was Mia. My food wasn't ready so I had to wait. The only person to acknowledge me was the guy checking Id

My husband and I visited TGI Friday SUNDAY Happy hour on several occasions.  I'm very upset that the food always come out cold.  I ask the sever to make sure my food is not cold when they bring it out. I'm almost afraid to send it back cause they alway send the same cold food back:  Not happy at all.

If I could I'd give this place negative...terrible fuckin service, rude as hell...food took an hour and a half to come out (for microwaved frozen appetizers) you could taste the freeze and to top it off an HOUR for the damn check...close this place down...wrong staff and terribly ran. That's why Applebee's is better

BEWARE went to this TGIF and my niece ordered lemonade and notice a piece of glass was in her mouth after drinking the lemonade. She also notice her tongue was cut. She then notice the glass cup was broken.. The manager came over immediately came over grabbed the piece of glass and broken cup. He asked was she OK..Then gave us another round of beverages and bought out the broken glass again filled with ginger ale Horrific Experience

Trust me, go to Applebees instead! Haven't been here in a while and now I remember why. Dirty and terrible service! Friends and I arrived for Happy Hour and had to wait 10 mins for our table to be cleaned. Then we were told we had less than 5 mins to order because the kitchen was "short staffed." Cherry on the sundae... we could only order certain items on the menu! Never again!

I don't understand how and or why service at this place can be piss poor. You walk in to 3-4 hosts at the stand and no one greets you. You basically feel like you showed up at someone's house uninvited. The 1 host that took my name proceeded to write me down as "dummy" and when I corrected him he changed it to "bummy". Seriously???   There was trash on the floor at the host stand. About 15 minutes into the wait I noticed multiple parties getting sat that had arrived well after me so I went up to check on the status. The host responded, "oh, the list is going smooth". Umm ok, but when will I get sat? Umm 10-15 minutes. So I continue to wait. And again I see 5 more parties that came in AFTER me get seated. I go up again to ask what the issue is, and they all seem  to be confused. I look at the list and my name is literally mid-list all the names before it crossed off and about 6 names after it crossed off. What in the actual fuck???? We got a lame apology and a, "we're seating you now". Followed the host to a table in the rear of the restaurant. It looked dirty. No silverware and a lovely fruit fly hovering over the salt & pepper shakers. And to top off the lovely experience the server never came to the table at all after us sitting there almost 10 minutes. EPIC FAILURE!!!!!  So we decided to leave and go somewhere else. Absolutely HORRIBLE experience.

THE WORST! I came to this Fridays for happy hour with friend and we left $28 on a $22 bill. We were talking for 15 min after we put the money down. Once we walked out and got to our car, one of the managers, Cathy, storms out of the restaurant to say that we only left $17 on the check! She said that she was taking down our driver plate numbers and demanded we need to come pay the rest.  Her reaction was ludicrous because our actions didn't indicate that we were running on the check. We willingly went back to rectify the situation. Only to see that THE LOST $10 WAS ON THE FLOOR BEHIND THE BAR!!  Two people behind the bar couldn't see it? Furthermore,  why did she readily assume that we ran out on the check before even checking her surroundings?!    Safe to say,  I WILL NOT BE GOING BACK.  The food and drinks were subpar as well!
This branch needs new management.

Horrible experience. Waited in the bar area for 20 minutes , since it was sit yourself area. Waiter never came so my party of 2 decided to move to the other side in which the waiters MUST actually WAIT on customers. Waitress was new and really tried her best, but was very slow. In this line of work the restaurant/ bar business is a very fast and attentive business. Hostess were lazy and not at ALL friendly. If this is not the job for you, please resign so someone else that appreciates working can take your place earn money.  CLEARLY i thought i was done writing this review but more foolishness happened....had to ask for eatery utensils and they were being washed according to our waitress. Folks, its only 8pm and the real night life crowd has not made their appearance yet. Never again will i come here

What is up with the damn staff WTF? I was getting my phone fixed up the road at CPR so I popped in for a drink. Place was dead it was around 10-11am on a Tuesday. I order a burger n beer. Mind you place is dead only about 2-4 people at bar, it takes the bar tender a good no joke 15-18 min to get me beer after I order. Then the beer was bad it had Shit floating in it, she like oh I didn't clear the tap, wtf man so since my last review no change place is beat. I will only come in if it's the last resort shit rather drive a few miles dwn road to get better service. I don't demand much but common man! I bet I can run this place better I'D have that staff fired place closed n hiring new pple stat!!

The service could better, bartender doesn't really know when the tap is empty lol.. Food was ok nothing fancy just came here for a liquid lunch with a friend from work.. Really Fridays work on your service!!!

This tgu fridays was so bad i dont recommend going there. I ordered mozzarella sticks they didnt have any then i ordered braised beef and there wasnt anything on there it was horribke will not come back.

I use to come to this Friday's all the time to meet up with my girlfriends, b/c it was convenient for all of us. However i do prefer the Linden location better...anyway I think when you come here or go to any bar you pretty much get what your looking for. I have never really had a problem, except for one time some years ago, I had a waiter that was EXTREMELY inattentive, like we never saw her again! Anyway, unless its somethings very blatant, I usually so engrossed in my company/conversation that once my food and drinks  arrives correct and hot, Im good! Go for happy hour, great deals. I like the new menu and food additions. After 9pm you have to present idea to sit in the bar area. Happy hour: 4-7 then 11pm to close. All day Sunday

Sad example of a good restaurant chain. Salad served on a warm plate ; big no no. Tap beer was funky tasting. Told the bartender and he apologized and said the line had not been cleaned for ever even though they have requested the waning from corporate.

Completely enjoyed my waiter. The food was also pretty good and the drinks where not too bad. Excellent for watch the game and a quick Sunday meal. Tried a couple of desserts for the first time ans that Oreo dessert was the best thing on the dessert menu. Try it.
This place is straight up booty.  The only restaurant that gets me upset because of how lazy these servers are. Damn shame.

Stopped in for a quick lunch. No wait time and now I know why. Place is filthy . Spotty glassware dirty table. Floor was disgusting. The place was only open for a half an hour so there is no excuse. Our waiter was nice and attentive but his shirt was filthy as well. Watched as two other tables came sat down and immediately left. I didn't really notice all the issues until was was midway through our apps. We took everything else to go. I'm not picky but avoid this place at all costs
Love coming here with my kids. The staff is always young and friendly here.

I wish i could give this restaurant 0 star, but i have no choice because the lowest rating in yelp is 1 star. I dont know how to describe how bad is this place is! No service at all, i think they just dont care and no managment presence. I have to ask so many time just to get my drinks and it takes forever place my food order. Imagine how they run the kitchen, i dont even wanna know because im not coming back to this TGI FRIDAY'S!

I wouldn't even give this place 1 star but that's all I could do. Service was extremely slow, bathrooms were horrible. We waited 20 minutes to be served beverages. While we sat and watched another group come in 30 minutes after us, and receive their food the same time as us. Managers were very unorganized and couldn't even help properly. All in all I will not come back to this establishment.
It's a chain - so there's not much to say.  The service is decent, the dining area is clean, and there's never a wait.

The food is OK depending on the chef working. They always manage to get my order wrong when I place it to go. It's almost like they completely disregard what I say I want and THEY decide what I want. I suggest hiring better workers.. That's the only solution

Worse Friday's ever.. Service is horrible and I love Fridays. Manager was not visible, had to find her to complain and she never even came to the table to acknowledge the gaps in service. The service levels were a complete reflection of how the management was running the place. Younger servers with no service accountability. Food was terrible, bland and half plated. I would have complained about that but it probably would have took 20 mins to do that.

The lone star is for the service and boneless wings.....If I could I would give zero for the other food nd drinks....the seared tuna gave me an upset stomach...the chip beneath the tuna was soggy nd smelly nd old...the Norwegian salmon was meh!!!...hopeless mashed potato... The mason jar drinks were like fruit juices...one pineapple and other one lemon...the hefe beer from the draft was flaaaaaaat... Will never step into this one again

No wait to sit in the bar area but server takes forever to bring menus and let's not even get into how long it takes for the drink let alone the food to come out. The server did not take any initiative to make me comfortable nor apologize for the wait. The manager took forever to come out after I asked for her, overall this Fridays is ATROCIOUS I'll stick to the West Orange location where I'm welcomed.

If I could rate this place 0 stars, I would. This is not my first time to a Friday's, so the account of my time here is ENTIRELY due to a horrible staff and disgusting practices. I went here with a friend of mine for dinner date. The moment I walked in it was a NIGHTMARE. The hostess told someone to "Get out her face" and then proceeded to ignore us walking in the door. Another girl just grabbed a few menus, more than our party of two needed, and sat us directly next to the kitchen and bathrooms. When I asked for different seating, she ignored me entirely and walked away. Our waitress came over after 20 minutes and when I said hello she just looked at me like I had three heads, then asked if we'd like something to drink. I ordered a cherry coke (which I had to explain not only what I meant by cherry, but also grenadine syrup) and my date ordered water, as we were already fearing the worst. After another 20 minutes, she came out with the two drinks, placed them in the wrong locations on the table, then walked away. After yet another 10 minutes she returned and asked us if we wanted to order, something she should have asked when she brought our drinks. My date ordered the 3 appetizers Thai pork tacos, Ahi Tuna Crisps, and the Corn beef and Swiss sliders. I ordered the 6oz Jack Daniel's steak and shrimp with spinach and mac and cheese sides. This all started coming out nearly 40 minutes after placing our order. Starting with the appetizers...they came out one at a time, despite my asking for them to come out at the same time. The Thai pork tacos were DISGUSTING. Unseasoned, no sauce, and the taco shell they were on was soggy, wet, and tasted old. They were so bad I almost threw up after my date insisted I try it. The Ahi Tuna Crisps were only slightly better, with the tuna being cooked unevenly, and had the consistency of rubber. The "crisps" they were on was also soggy. The corned beef and Swiss sliders were dry, the swiss tasted almost like cleaning products, and were inedible. My meal was a true tragedy. The plate I was warned is "very hot," but upon touching it, I was shocked to feel it nearly ice cold. Presentation was non existent, as the steak had a half melted pad of butter placed on top, the greens were tossed clearly from one end of the plate to the other making the entire plate covered in water, and the shrimp were sitting, soaking up the water from the greens, making their batter soggy. The mac & cheese came out 20 minutes after I had begun eating. The steak was like a piece of shoe leather, and it was not a Jack Daniel's steak. It was a regular 6 oz sirloin that was not done Medium, as I asked...it was instead so well done, there was nothing left of it. After mentioning this to the waitress, she quickly got then tossed Jack Daniel's sauce onto my table in a little cup and walked away immediately. The shrimp were over cooked and as I mentioned before, soggy. The greens were hardly cooked at all, and were mixed in with onions and mushrooms that come with the regular sirloin. After taking a bite, I tasted something with the consistency of sand in the greens. I was terrified and stopped eating them immediately. The mac & cheese, which was cold by the time it came out, was so god awful. I tasted it and there was NO cheese. It was noodles, which were not fully cooked, topped with bread crumbs. After a miserable night, and after not seeing the manager despite my asking, I payed the bill, regretfully. I will never...ever...EVER in my life return to this place. If you have any common sense, STAY AWAY FROM THIS FRIDAY'S! It is a disgustingly mismanaged place with NO customer service skills in its entire staff, and it should be closed.

I'm giving this place 1 star because 0 stars was not an option... Worst Friday's ever. Waited 30 minutes for appetizers, server apologized and said they were really busy in the kitchen... Guess they weren't prepared for customers on a Sunday afternoon! Finally our appetizers come out! Cold, soggy and burnt... It was sooo busy in the kitchen, my appetizers had time to get over-cooked AND cool off before getting to my table. Didn't even bother ordering entrees...

I've been to good Friday's and I've been to bad ones, but never have I been to one that straight up lies to me. My friends ordered the three for all appetizer which is smaller portions of appetizers but not this small were told that we get 2 mozzarella sticks one pretzel stick and 3 wings,which didn't even have sauce on them. Then we were told that our sodas didn't have free refills and we could pay or  have water. The managers answer? The items are new and they're still getting used to them. Since when did Friday's open yesterday? Cola is not new.

I literally just came here for a soup bowl sized container of Jack Daniels sauce for which I called ahead so it could be ready when I got there. Why I was standing there for ten minutes is beyond me. It was so empty in there and people just kept walking past and making eye contact but not saying anything.  Why me, Lord? Why me? The host stopped running long enough to check his phone and then asked if he could help me. I could tell from his voice that he was the same person I spoke to over the phone. I told him that I was there for the JD sauce which apparently wasn't ready because he scurried off and came back with a small cup which was not what I asked for. He scurried off again and then came back only to notify me that the manager said he can only sell it by the bag which was 24.99 even though I have bought a container for 7.99 on previous occasions. The employee made it seem as though it would be no problem and I did not appreciate having to wait around for 20 minutes just to be told no.
Food and service was good but everytime we asked our waiter something he seemed irked

If you love to get awful service, watered down drinks, and cold food then you should definitely check out the TGIF on Rt.22 in Springfield! Ordered two drinks and an appetizer the other day. The drinks were awful, the incompetent bar staff managed to mess up a whiskey and coke. Aside from that, the lime I got in the drink was frozen. Asked for a side of blue cheese with our food, the blue cheese never came. The bartender was too busy talking to a friend across the bar for about 15 minutes, so when we finally got his attention to get the side....our food was already cold. I guess they were aging the blue cheese in the back because it took forever for it to eventually come out. We didn't even get utensils, I had to get up and go to a nearby table and snag some because the bartender never brought them. Overall it was a horrendous experience. I don't expect much from a TGIF, but its almost as if they work extra hard just to give you an awful dining experience.

Have been a regular (2-3 times a week) for lunch at this location and have always like the courteous staff, but in the last few months the food quality has taken a real nose dive.  Twice got a burger that was bloody and dripping in the center and the appetizer came out after the meal.  Still like the staff but something not right with the food prep.  Don't think I'll go back since there are lots of choices in the area.

This location sucks ass.....I love Fridays to go get some decent food and decent drinks sometimes...but this one right on 22 will never see my face again. The bartenders never made a drink for me after trying to flag them down for 30+ minutes..At this point I went to the manager to put in a complaint..to my surprise he actually went to tlk to them right away.. and of course he gave some coupons and stuff..which i will use at the another Fridays.  I will not recommend this Fridays to anyone...rich poor..black..white..old..young...NOBODY!!!

Although TGIF is usually pretty standard it happened to be below the quality they usually put out.    Service was slow and they seem uninterested.   But then again we are not talking about 5 star establishment either.

Had the worst experience at this establishment, it was hair in my cousin drink and the waitress was a prick and I'm never coming back here again, when you pay to have dinner at these places and to get attitudes and horrible service is crazy

Went to TGIF on Sunday 10/20/2013 for lunch with my partner and his mom.  Waiter was very nice but seemed a bit flustered.  Our lunches were brought out with an issue on each. 1- My partner ordered the triple stack Reuben and asked for very well done fries (this assures that they are fresh and not coming from under a heat lamp).  The order arrived with soggy, warm fries. The waiter asked him "are they well done enough for you?".  After my partner tasted them and responded that they were not hot or crisp, the waiter said that he would bring another order, which arrived the same way the first order arrived. 2- My partners mom ordered the skillet garlic shrimp.  She loved it EXCEPT for the fact that it had 7 large, uncooked cloves of garlic in it. Nothing ruins your taste buds like biting into raw garlic.   3- I ordered the sizzling chicken and shrimp.  Just as disgusting as it gets.  The shrimp (with tails on) came in an acidic, bitter tomato sauce.  The grilled chicken (which was on melted yellow American cheese) was so over cooked that the two small pieces were the size of a jumbo egg.  After fighting with two shrimps to remove the tails without making a huge mess, I just gave up.  The waiter came to our table twice, saw that my plate was intact and never asked if there was anything wrong with the meal.  Finally, he came to give us our check and I told him that my dish was just disgusting and I, obviously did not like it.  He said that he would send a manager over.   The manager who came to our table was the a piece to the puzzle as to why the kitchen did not know which end was up.  She made excuses about everything.  I pointed out the large, uncooked  garlic on my partners moms dish.  The manager claims that they make their dish that way and even oven roast their garlic daily.  From where I was sitting, the garlic was raw and never saw the inside of an oven.  As for my dish, she claims that the gentleman who wrote their menu is now a multimillionaire.  I would gather that if that was the case, Fridays over paid tremendously.   Stay away from this place unless you enjoy having smoke blown up your behind from the waitstaff to the management.

Dinner was good we had great conversation and the service was ok. I wasn't wow'ed though so hopefully the service will get better over time ...plenty of other spots to select from in the area if it doesn't ...but I'm all for second chances.

I can not begin to tell anyone how poor the service was.  It was a busy Friday night but even so, our orders got mixed up, we received our appetizers after our entrees and they sent out the wrong entree.  This was all after waiting ONE FULL HOUR for our food and 40 minutes for a cocktail.  We will never, ever eat there again.  Clueless staff and manager.

The service was great, but the food was lackluster at best. I order the Jack Daniels Chicken and Shrimp. The chicken was thin and barely had sauce on it and the shrimp was fried, which look nothing like the shrimp on the menu. I think TGI Friday's in general have gone done hill.

Service is a hell of a lot better compared to the Fridays on 1&9...but the food lacks in comparison. Final word: if you prefer service over food, go here. If not, go to the one on 1&9. The food there is Jesus worthy.

The worst experience I've ever had in a restaurant period.  oh except for that time i came her when they first opened many years ago.  If you like the worst service and disgusting cold food then by all means come here.  I can only blame management, btw I had to find the manager and it was clear he was in over his head.  When I say worst, I mean I would have enjoyed eating old spam on a subway toilet seat next to a passed out homeless person more than the experience I had here!

We were craving Fridays because my husband and I always liked their food. This was one of our worst experiences ever. We entered and the two hosts were talking unprofessionally to each other (saying ratchet etc) Once they sat us, the table smelled like dirty water. Our waitress took 10 minutes just to bring us water. The people eating around us were very loud and kids were kicking the backs of our chair a lot, so we moved ourselves. We got our appetizer first which was good. Then my husband got his food first. Which is odd because usually all restaurants bring all the food together unless you tell them not to. I waited 20 minutes to get my food, thus I couldn't enjoy dinner together with my husband. The waitress actually gave my food to the wrong table that's why it took a long time. When we asked to talk to the manager, he didn't look professional. I complained and said that your waitress has an attitude and all he did was take $2 off the bill. Then finally when we were paying and signing our bill and writing the tip in, the waitress didn't even wait until we left our table to get the check book. She opened the book in front of us to see the tip and gave us a dirty look. Worst service ever!!! AVOID AT ALL COSTS TO GO TO THIS UNPROFESSIONAL FRIDAYS.

Best service I might have gotten all week. Our waitress was super nice to us, and our food and drinks were brought out promptly. We got the 2 for 20 deal which was great. Tons of food and I would go back to this Friday's.
Id rather spend a night at alcatraz then ever come back here.  I asked for a second beer and the bartender asked me if i wanted it in the same glass as my firat. Straight disaster.

Stopped in Friday 8/23/13 around 5:40 pm. Place was not busy at all. My first impression was the place is dirty but I sat down anyway. Bad move. Ordered a tap beer that was on the warm side. Service was slow despite the place ring empty. Food was typical for this typical for this type of place but the longer I stayed the more I noticed how poor this place is kept

I'm with Keisha on this one.  I usually like Friday's for an average meal, and they usually have Guinness on tap.  Here, the food was average as usual, but of 3 guys behind the bar, only one finally paid attention to me after he stopped trying to be Tom Cruise flipping his bottle behind the bar and talking to the jersey shore guidos.  Fridays usually gets 3 stars from me, but the lack of service was noticeable.

This is the worst TGIF I have ever seen. Lousy service, no courtesy, and shame. They screwed up our order twice. I never expected this kind of service. Will never go to the place again and make sure no one else that I know, ever goes tere

In the list of subcategories, there should be one entitled "Office Space", and thereby allowing you to collect all of the Ground Rounds, Chilis, TGIFs, Houlihans, and Ruby Tuesdays of the United States in one, easy to manage spot. I propose this because, without failure, an employee celebration just isn't a celebration unless the entire team assembles at an Office Space and orders diet Cokes and burgers and Caesar salads.  And then pretend not to be pissed that they can't order six pitchers of Yuengling and do shots while getting the soon-departing co-worker totally hammered.   Four stars?  Am I crazy?  All right, consider this.  The food comes out quick.  They understand "medium" means "almost not pink" not "bloody" and not "Kingsford".  They are quick on the refills.  They have World Cup soccer on every television at the bar every four years, like it supposed to be, and tuned to Univision instead of ESPN2.  In short, they get it right. I'm sorry, I have a case of the Mondays. -C
Worst TGIF ever!! Management is horrible.. staff is disrespectful and useless!!! You won't get waited on and the food is disgusting! There are fruit flies everywhere and silverware feels greasy!!

Worst experience I have ever had at a Friday's, scratch that any restaurant! My boyfriend and I went there for dinner at about 8pm. We sat down and no one came to our table until 20 min later after I asked a manager who was sitting in the back on his "Friday's laptop" if he knew who our server was. When he finally arrived he did not apologize and was very rude. He took our orders. Not surprisingly our app took 25 min to arrive. Our drink order was incomplete and about 10 min later our server comes back with the rest of it.... A half empty warm beer bottle. HORRIBLE The person cleaning the tables walked around with some sort of plastic container throwing all the food from every table when the CUSTOMERS WERE STILL SITTING AT A TABLE!! So gross... After waiting for another 20 minutes and our server was no where to be found we decided we had enough and we were leaving. We walked out and noticed the host and all the servers hanging out in the front. NO ONE even noticed. AVOID this Friday's at all cost.

Loved the service.Ours waiter Elnar was exceptionally good.Food was good.Took the 3 course combo and the entree and dessert were just awesome.Been roaming around to locate a good place for dinner and landed here...Thank God It's Good!
Looks good since the redesign but service, at this location is still very poor.... Slow....

OK so we all know that TGIF is what it is, however this particular Fridays location has to be one of the dirtiest and loudest in the chain.  Every time we come here it seems to get worse! The families who come here allow their children to run amok, making a noisy busy environment that much worse to endure. The servers just let the kids take over, climbing over booths and running in the aisles. Most of our silverware was dirty so we had to ask for new utensils.  If they allow the floors to get a bit more sticky I am adding this to our NJ dive bar list :/

My friends and I came to this location last night, and we were originally extremely disappointed with the service because it was extremely slow. It took almost 30 minutes just to receive our beverage. But thanks to James J. not sure what his position was, but we complained to him and he saved the day. I've never met anyone so understanding and helpful. He listened to everything we had to say and explained to us how they were short staffed that evening. Not that's an excuse for a business, but James was just extremely helpful towards our situation, and he was actually new to that location. Make sure to ask for him when you visit! Thank you James!

The best thing about this Friday's was Corlo(Anthony), The Bartender. The stench by the bar area was like that of old mop water. They do not rush to clean up. When i arrived the bar was almost full with dirty dishes and the Bartender was alone with no one to help him. My friend and i received our food in a short amount of time, however there were people who were definitely there well before us and they complained of how the food was taking over an hour. They hadn't even received an appetizer. Overall the service was poor and the manager Cathy(i think thats her name) had no excuse for the poor service that was received or the nasty stench of the bar. i will never go back here.
WORST experience ever. All employees looks like they are in their own nightmare. They like what they are doing so, service sucks.
Well all I can say is I've been to many Friday's,...and this is the worst. I promised myself I would never come here again but hey it's Christmas Eve and they're the only game in town.

Worst FRIDAY's EVER!!!!!!!! Dirty glasses, dirty utensils, an hour to get appetizers, no napkins, everybody's food is cold, my food was hard,we all had to go to the bar to get drinks because the servers never came back, 2 orders came with no sauce with there wings, AND THE WORST PART IS IT'S NOT EVEN BUSY!!!! PS you have to get ID to get in the bar area, then they make you show ID again when you order drinks WTF

Overall awful experience. Which is consistent to what I am reading from other reviews. The worst Friday's I have ever been to. Drinks took forever, and one of them never even came. By the time the food came, my salad was drenched in dressing and my friends salad had a dead bug in it, my moms salad had no dressing on it. After asking for management, he seemed really out of it and not enthusiastic about apologizing at all, not very good management,  While we appreciated that they deducted the two salads and gave us 25% off, we will never be going back to this Friday's.

Horrible hostess. We walked in as a party of two, got not hello how are you, instead a hold on. A party of 7 of the same color as the hostess walked in and was greeted in a friendly manner with an enthusiastic smile and seated immediately. Good service? I think not. Very rude and discriminating.

The weakest drinks I've ever had. I wish I could say something nice about this spot but...the service was weak, the food was average, and the server didn't ask why I only took a sip of my drink.  Won't be coming back.

Terrible service. Made us get up and move to another seat causer "no one was serving that area". 5 mins later, a Caucasian couple came in and was seated in our previous seats. No one greeted us. And the hostesses had attitudes. Driving an extra 30mins to eat another location.

Ok let me start by saying I love going to Friday's for drinks to catch up with my friends. But last night I had the WORST SERVICE EVER. We waited 20 before someone even came to clean off our table and then WE WAITED 50 minutes to get our drinks the waiter was non-existent.  We asked to speak with a manager who came immediately he said he was going to look into the situation but he never came back. ( We later found out that the manager had a heart attack and had to be taken away by the ambulance I hope he's ok. )  Then we spoke with the next manager and she wasn't apologetic about the situation. I'm going to keep this short WORST SERVICE EVER I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO THIS LOCATION.  AND I RECOMMEND THAT YOU GO TO ANY OTHER LOCATION BUT THIS ONE  I AM A VERY UNSATISFIED CUSTOMER .

This place is an absolute joke and I will never return again. Rude waitresses with no training , food took nearly an hour to come out. I ordered a french onion soup and it arrived at the same time as my food.  The other persons food came out after mines. Waitress barely checked on us and when she did she was rude. Even to get the check took another 20 minutes . What a mess.

CREDIT CARD FRAUD at this location. I have my receipt... and am very organized financially.... when i went to check... whoever processed the receipt, adjusted the total amount and then added even more tip on top of that. I reported them to my bank already. Be very careful... I bet they make a killing by slightly adjusting these totals and people probably dont even realize it. BE VERY CAREFUL. ZERO STARS

I've been here several times but last night is the first time the service was soooo slow and inadequate. I went with a group of friends and for a Saturday night, there was no line waiting to sit down. We were seated immediately. That was great! After that, it went downhill from there, we had to wait about 15-20 minutes before anyone came to our table to take our drink orders! It wasn't busy and the waitress seemed flustered or maybe she was new but there were 6 of us and we were hungry, It took awhile before our appetizers came out. The service was definitely inadequate. I had to ask another waitress for napkins, another one for utensils and another one for straws. It was ridiculous. She took forever  to get our bills  and then had to make several corrections. Although the service could have been better, the food was somewhat decent. We all ordered something different and there was only one complaint. Its pretty much a hit or miss if you come here.

Worse Fridays I have ever been to. Had to ask for menu's, did not provide us with eating utensils, took on avg 10-20 mins to receive any drinks, took half an hour for my order of fries, rung up my friends order wrong twice, and then got upset when I wrote on the receipt "God Bless for Better Service". I still tipped him 40% gratuity nonetheless. His excuse was that he was serving 8 tables, Friday's was empty on Super Bowl Sunday and the establishment was definitely staffed enough to provide better customer service to everybody.

NEVER MIND DINING! The ABSOLUTE WORST EXPERIENCE I have ever had! I would never ever go let even my worst enemy give them any business! This establishment is the WORST run restaurant I have ever seen.  I can't believe they r still open! Absolute chaos!  And the staff are the not trained well & the most unprofessional food service staff I can remember.  Facts:  Visit  10/19/13 Saturday night Once our party placed our order it took over 45 mins to get the appetizers. The server apologized n said the "kitchen crashed" and "the entire ordering system was down!" But from that point it was still 20 minutes before any food was brought to the table.  Tables that came in 30 mins after us got there entrees before we got ours! When we finally got our dinner it took almost an hour mine was not my order! After all that I wasn't even right?  I told serve h took it back. It took 10 mins to get the right item...and it still wasn't my order!   Now on latest attempt it was not prepared as requested an served with a sauce I cannot eat because of a food allergy as I told my server when I placed the order.  ??? Every table around us was losing their minds complaining asking to see the manager. The manager took 20 minutes to show his face. By that time every table was comparing "issues".  Consensus was "never ever, ever again!  Worst Fridays experience ever!" People were waiting for more than 30 mins just to get an accurate check n settle it? Really! The ship is going down in a hurry and the captain doesn't have a clue! The worst dining nightmare of my life over almost 3 hours and at that point the only concession I was offered was the item that could have made me very sick I wasn't charged for?  Actually the first check wasn't even correct. I had to show the server his mistake. So even taking inordinate time to provide the most basic of services was not enough to even get things satisfactory or really substandard! I couldn't even get a bill that was "looked over" for accuracy after waiting for it for more than 30 mins! The entire experience was so totally draining n really so frustrating n completely exasperating no one in their right mind would ever go back!r

The service was terrible! VINNY IS THE WORST WAITER We were seated after 10 minutes of standing. Once seated we didnt get menus or drinks for another 15 minutes! We told the hostess, waited 5 more minutes then left. No one even tried to stop us. We came back in to tell the manager and he gave us a free app to stay. Then we had to STRUGGLE to get service! Took forever to get our food and they messed the orders up TWICE! All around a horrible horrible experience! Everyone was so rude!
This is one of the better Fridays I have been to. New and clean. Great to watch sports.

The service SUCKS!!! They have a fake security guard at the door like you're entering a club who was rude. The manager never came around to ask if everything was ok, service was EXTREMELY slow! My party complained to someone named Pierre who said he was the manager, he did nothing to resolve the issue nor compensate our terrible experience. Will never come here again!!!

I came here last night with a few of my coworkers. It wasn't our first time here. We were familiar with the menu and familiar with the crowd. I started my order with an Electric Lemonade and for my entree I choose the Sicilian Stacked burger with fries. Here is where the trouble started.  Two of my other coworkers had ordered burgers and there's came out DELICIOUS looking! When they bit into their burgers juices were clearly flowing. I had ordered my medium, and from the pictures...clearly my burger was messed up from the beginning. This burger was SUPPOSED to come out with two parties, mozzarella sticks, marinara sauce, and cheese. And from my pictures you can TELL the first burger they placed in front of me was an insult. I had asked the waiter to bring me mayonnaise thinking this was want the burger was supposed to be. It was the driest burger ever! Two bites in I realize I can't manage to finish this dry burger. It's the equivalent to swallowing sandpaper. He gets the manager and she takes one look at my sandwich and KNOWS her kitchen staff messed up badly. I tell her I just wanna get the brownie dessert and forget about giving me another burger.  Here's where the better part is! She sends me my dessert AND what the BEAUTIFUL new burger that my first burger was supposed to be with a full plate of fries. She tells me that the burger is free and that I can take it home. It looked so much better I couldn't help but to take a bite out of it and it tastes BEYOND BETTER.  Would I come back here...possibly. A strong maybe. I'm sad my main entree wasn't as good as my coworkers at the times they were eating it, but the manager gave me excellent customer service. This is why it's given THREE stars instead of TWO.

I've been to many different locations. Me and my date stumbled across this one about an hour before closing. Our waiter was less than attentive. I went without a refill on my drink for most of my meal. He never even asked me if I wanted another one, or noticed that my cup was empty. our food took forever, and so did he coming back with our bill. Not a fan.
We were seated in the most empty section in the restaurant where nobody else was. Waited over 15 minutes. No service. We left and went somewhere else. No excuses.

horrible customer service. walked in, hostess didn't even take us to our table. he told us where it was and we sat ourselves. didn't give us menus after minutes waiting we got up and got them ourselves. nobody came to take order for maybe 15 mins. tried to complain to manager and he didn't want to come out, instead he sent the same hostess out with coupons. very upsetting.
Medium well is not the same as medium rare!  It's not rocket science. The waitress was ok but zero personality. First and last time I go.

We sat down immediately, but waited almost 10 minutes before our waiter greeted us.  We placed our complete order. The Screaming Tiki was all ice. I was done in 6 sips. The food wasn't that great. The French Onion soup had no onions. It was all broth.  The Jack Daniel's Chicken and Shrimp came with no sauce. We had to ask for sauce, ended up leaving half of the food anyway. Usually the manager passes by to ask how was the service, but I guess he or she was busy with everyone else's complaints. I even told that the waitress that we weren't happy with the food, and yet no one passed by. We've come here a few times, and this was the worst experience by far.

Happy hour specials are good deals I guess. We were sat at a table in the bar and the rolled utensils were wrapped in soaking wet napkins that were torn up and disgusting. We asked for new ones and the waitress gave us two new pairs of utensils arguably more soaking wet than the first pair. The chipotle salad I got was made with lettuce that was clearly sitting out at room temperature for hours if not days. Wilted and shriveled like a 90 year olds scrotum. The chicken they put on it is cold and dry. Not dry from being over cooked but looks like the chicken was left in front of a fan all day and formed a jerky like look and texture on the outside. The Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta was a lumpy sauced mess. There was more cartilage than meat on the chicken and maybe two shrimps. SHAME SHAME SHAME!!!

I literally only come here out of a matter of convenience at this point. If you are within driving distance of any other Friday's, do yourself a favor and don't even bother coming here. The service sucks. The drinks are watered down. The food is subpar. Even the manager is terrible. If I never come here again it'll be too soon

This is an update to my miserable experience from last year at the Springfield rte 22 chain - I wrote in a complaint to the company website and got a response that we would get a complimentary meal as a gesture of good will - punchline - never received the complimentary meal - no surprise there - will never go to a TGIFs again - terrible customer service - used to be great - loved this chain, what happened??
The unlimited appetizers are pretty generic and the bacon on the potato skins is never crispy but the servers are attentive and the energy is positive.

Worst Friday's I've ever been to, and I've been to some pretty bad Friday's locations. We went on a Saturday at 12, the restaurant was pretty empty but it took about 15 minutes for the waiter to get our drinks. I got a beer that was not poured correctly into the glass and to make matters worse my glass was filthy and had mystery particles in there so I asked the waiter to just get me a glass of water in a clean glass (that glass was also dirty). So, from that point we were spot checking all the silverware to make sure it was clean.  We ordered appetizers and that was another 25 minutes, my appetizer came out warm but my wife's was cold but they tasted fine, like any other Friday's.  Our entrees took another 25-30 minutes and were subpar compared to other Friday's locations.  I requested a medium well burger and it tasted like a hockey puck, my wife got the same thing and hers was undercooked.  Overall, drinks were mediocre, appetizers were ok, entrees were blegh. On top of the bad food the service was terrible, our waitress was only waiting on 4 tables and we were there for almost two and a half hours. I'm usually content going to Friday's because I stick to my favorites but this place somehow managed to completely scree that up. If you're in the area drive the extra 5-10 minutes to get to the one in the Blue Star plaza so you don't waste your money.

Where do i start. This is the worse Friday's I been to in my life (yes my whole life). The food was horrible and the service completely sucks. It took 20 minute to even get acknowledged by the hostess then another 20 more minutes to even get a waitress and a menu. Attitude everywhere OMG, and every time i ask for something they had to ask their manager. The manager is treating them like a CHILD if they cannot make any decision with their managers approval.  I wanted my meal with no cheese and they could not do it and she had to ask her manager, but two days before at the East Hanover Fridays (Best friday's Ever) the waitress gave me my meal with no cheese. The House/Ultimate margarita(Had high hopes) was maybe the worstttt drink i have ever had in my life. Water, with crushed ice and lemmon stuff at the bottom of the glass, literally.  I wish i had something good to say about this fridays but i really dont, even the food was watery and tasteless. Well the shrimp was good at least, cant mess that up.  Stay away YELPERS, dont say i didn't warn you.

This place is ok.  Food is good but I think quality has gone down on some items.  I ordered the sizzling chicken and shrimp.  It was good but the chicken could have been a little thinner.  My son had the kids pizza and loved it.  Service was good.  We were seated promptly considering it was a Friday night and they were crowded. Our server took good care of us too.  We'll be back again.

The hostess took a little while to get to us. I was with my children. The food looked great but then I tried my ribs and they where hard. I told the hostess when she came back and she just smile and said awwe really and then said do you want more honey mustard for my kids chicken fingers. I'm not one to complain but she could've said do you want me to get you another order or let me get the manager. I actually ended up paying for it even though I didn't touch it. I guess the hostess was new but I call that bad training then cause she did seem very nice but unaware on what to do in that situation. I never really had an issue with this location but this turned me away a little. Also the fact that the hostess had the nerve to ask if we wanted desert without me even touching my ribs was kind of a turn off from this location.

Been to a few different TGI Friday's across NJ and PA areas, this might be the worst one of them all.  We ordered burgers and appetizers... all of which tasted like it was just microwaved.  I think we would have done better at White Castle just across the street.  The waitress that we had seemed to have little motivation in providing any attention to our table.  She seemed more interested in gossiping with her fellow co-workers. The only bright spot, and I mean ONLY...was the young, red-haired lady who sat us down.  She smiled and engaged us in pleasant conversation while walking us to our table.  It really is very sad that the hostess at a restaurant is the only person who seems genuinely interested in providing a positive experience while dining there.  If she reads this...run to another restaurant, you deserve better.
Very bad service cold food , find another place this was the wort dinner a had period

Chow Hole see low ratings for this restaurant on Yelp prior to attending.  However, Chow Hole pleasantly surprised with good service that was attentive, and wanting to make sure Chow Hole had good eating experience.  Maybe New manager in charge hoping to turn this place around.  And if planned accordingly Chow Hole can get oil changed at Valvoline center across the parking lot.
Worst service from a Friday's. I always com here because it's closer just hoping it will get better. Slow service, wrong orders, and somehow the food is worse too! Worth the drive up to Watchung.

Needed a place to watch football that was kid-friendly.  I'll admit that I was surprised, but we really enjoyed ourselves here. Good service from our waitress, and great TV setup.  Kids menu was good, and our food was solid.  We left happy, and the kids left full.

I didn't have a problem with the food. I was seeing all these reviews and I was scared to go. But I went because I had a little get together. It seriously was not bad! I had for appetizers wings- Sriracha Buffalo, main dish- chipotle yucatan chicken salad and since it was happy hour I had the ultimate lemonade. I was satisfied and the bar tenders were super nice. The music wasn't super loud for me not to hear the person I was with. Enjoyed my time and will try another dish if I come back and update my review if needed.
